title: Taylor Swift obsesses over banana in post-LASIK surgery video clip
text:
She got an extra surprise on Thursday during her guest appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.

Unbeknownst to Swift, 29, her mother, Andrea Swift, captured a hilarious video of the singer after her recent LASIK eye surgery that Fallon revealed they would be broadcasting on the show mid-interview.

'That's on television?' the Lover singer asks in shock after the video rolls.

Swift after surgery: Unbeknownst to Taylor Swift,29, her mother captured a hilarious video of the singer after an eye operation that Fallon revealed they would be broadcasting on the show mid-interview on Thursday

The Look What You Made Me Do hitmaker was stunned when talk show host Jimmy Fallon was aware she'd recently undergone laser eye surgery because she hasn't told many people about it, but she's very pleased with the results.

Jimmy asked: 'Didn't you just get LASIK surgery?' to which Taylor replied: 'I did how do you know that? I don't even tell people that. It was great, I really can see very well.'

The host then quizzed her: 'Do they give you painkillers or laughing gas?'

Confused, Taylor said: 'They definitely give you some pretty hardcore pills after you have a laser in your eye. What is going on? What's happening right now?'

Surprise world premiere: In the clip, the ME! singer can be seen fumbling with a bunch of bananas while wearing a brown puppy face sweater and a protective plastic shield over her eyes

Going bananas: 'The wasn't the one I wanted,' Taylor pouts before ripping off another banana

The blonde beauty looked horrified when the 'Tonight Show' host revealed the source of his knowledge - her mother Alison.

He said: 'Your mum may or may not have video taped you after surgery and she gave us the video.'

Taylor exclaimed: 'For the television?' as the host explained: 'This is the world premiere. Check this out. This is Taylor Swift, post-surgery. You were, like, freaking out over a banana.'

Next move: Her mom helps her rip off the 'right' banana and then Swift puzzles: 'What do we do with this one now?

In the clip, a drugged up Swift can be seen fumbling with a bunch of bananas while wearing a brown puppy face sweater and a protective plastic shield over her eyes.

The hilarious clip showed Taylor getting upset as she tried to take a piece of fruit for a snack while her mother warned her not to cry.

She snapped off a banana from the bunch then said: 'That wasn't the one I wanted...I tried to get this one.

Her mom helps her rip off the 'right' banana and then Swift puzzles: 'What do we do with this one now? It doesn't have a head. OK, I'm fine, fine.'

This s*** is bananas: Banana in hand, Swift is then escorted back to her bed so she can get some rest.

Resting: Later, Swift can be seen laying in bed comically munching on her treat

'I'll eat it. I'll eat it. It's mine,' Mama Swift answers, with the Blank Space singer whining: 'But it doesn't have a head!' .

Banana in hand, Swift is then escorted back to her bed so she can get some rest.

The camera then cut to the ME! hitmaker eating her banana while lying down and her mother warning her not to fall asleep while eating.

'Don't fall asleep eating your banana, ok?' Swifts mom says, to which Taylor mutters: 'I'm not asleep. My mind is alive.'

Wide awake! 'Don't fall asleep eating your banana, ok?' Swifts mom says

One liners: 'I'm not asleep. My mind is alive,' Taylor responds

As the show cut back to the studio, Jimmy urged his guest not to be 'mad' at him, but Taylor admitted she'd be having words with her mother when she got home.

'Don't be mad at me. I may have made some calls,' Fallon says to a shocked Swift when the clip ends.

She exclaimed: 'Oh my God! That's on television. She was kind enough to drive me there but cruel enough to give it to you.

Surprise! 'Don't be mad at me. I may have made some calls,' Fallon says to a shocked Swift when the clip ends

Relatably embarrassing: 'That's on television?' the Lover singer asks in shock after the video rolls

'I had these goggles on, which are really high fashion, and then they had to tape them to my head. I was crying I think, over a banana. Oh my gosh. I'm gonna tell her something.'

She also revealed her favorite song on the program during a game called Name That Song Challenge.

They took turns naming songs played by house band The Roots and Taylor correctly answered Baby One More Time by Britney Spears and Jimmy rightly guessed the next song was Pour Some Sugar On Me by Def Leppard.

Favorite song: Taylor revealed her favorite song Thursday while playing a game on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon

Taylor then beat Jimmy to the punch on the next song after just a few beats.

'It's Nelly. It's Nelly. It's Nelly. It's 'Hot In Herre'. This is my favorite song,' Taylor revealed as she danced to the 2002 tune.

'How did you guess that from that?,' Jimmy asked.

'Just like, middle school imprints on you,' Taylor said.

Game time: The 29-year-old pop star faced off against Jimmy, 45, in a game called Name That Song Challenge

Quick answer: Taylor after just a few beats correctly guessed The Roots were playing her favorite song Hot In Herre by Nelly

She also correctly guessed the 1997 song Kiss Me by Sixpence None The Richer and revealed it was the first song she learned to play on guitar.

Taylor received a standing ovation when she later stepped out for her interview.

She was promoting her upcoming appearance as musical guest this weekend on Saturday Night Live.

Musical guest: The singer was promoting her upcoming appearance on Saturday Night Live

Taylor also spoke about her upcoming Lover Fest tour in the summer of 2020 in support of her new hit album Lover.

She has seven shows planned in Europe, one in Brazil and two shows at SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles as part of the Lover Fest West and two shows at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts as part of Lover Fest East.

'Basically, I just kind of felt like this album, I was going to try something new. I haven't done festivals in a really long time and I just saw this album as like, a really festival-y album,' Taylor said.

Lover tour: Taylor also spoke about her upcoming Lover Fest tour in the summer of 2020 in support of her new hit album Lover

She added that she also wanted the opportunity 'to open a stadium in L.A., which is really exciting'.

It was announced last month that Taylor's concerts on July 25 and July 26 will be the grand opening event to open the SoFi Stadium located at the former site of the Hollywood Park Racetrack in Inglewood, California.

The stadium will serve as the home to the Los Angeles Rams and Los Angeles Chargers of the National Football League.

Swift's appearance on the talk show comes just two days before she's set to perform at this weekend's Saturday Night Live.

The shows official Twitter account tweeted out a promo for the upcoming episode, which will be hosted by the creator and star of Fleabag, Phoebe Waller-Bridge.

🎉 Phoebe Waller-Bridge hosts the show this weekend with musical guest @taylorswift13 🎉 pic.twitter.com/8yN64eq9WS — Saturday Night Live - SNL (@nbcsnl) October 3, 2019

Stadium opening: It was announced last month that Taylor's concerts on July 25 and July 26 will be the grand opening event to open the SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.
description: Unbeknownst to Swift, 29, her mother, Andrea Swift, captured a hilarious video of the singer after her recent LASIK eye surgery that Fallon revealed they would be broadcasting on the show mid-interview.
